channel.title: Vrealize Operations Manager on Virtualizing a Physical World
channel.description: Recent content in Vrealize Operations Manager on Virtualizing a Physical World

item.title: VMware vRealize Operations Manager: Licensing and License Groups
item.description: Licensing Maintaining valid licensing in vRealize Operations Manager is crucial to getting the most out of the tool. To begin the discussion on licensing there are two key concepts: the license and the license group. A license is a key that provides specific features and capabilities to vRealize

item.title: VMware vRealize Operations Manager: Design Introduction
item.description: Sizing a vRealize Operations Manager Environment VMware vRealize Operations Manager is the flagship monitoring suite for the entire VMware Software Defined Datacenter stack. The software is incredibly powerful, but it can be a bit daunting to a newcomer. Each update has improved out of the box functionality, however there is a lot to learn to master the software and truly make the most out of its features. Every successful environment starts with a strong design.

item.title: VMware vRealize Operations Manager: Design for a Home Lab
item.description: Designing for a Home Lab A practical way to gain experience with vRealize Operations Manager is to deploy and implement it into a home lab. A design for a home lab almost seems too simple, but planning it out and diagraming a simple example can help when the time comes to design a production environment. The environment will need to support the following: Monitor 100 Objects Monitor 10 End Point Operations Management agents The environment is also resource constrained, and the node can be no larger than a Small node size.
